intro: Psychotria longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent yellow or orange corona. Psychotria longituba is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
